well umm I think Bill over charged you for something that should come with =
it...I got it directly from the guy who make them....Skywatching one????=C2=
=A0 there is not one called that??
=C2=A0this is the one I have...its $340 =
its the best one out there but you can get by with a cheaper one....By the =
way this needs no light at all as a matter of fact the makers suggest as li=
ttle light as possible..when using it in no light it looks like its day lig=
ht its amazing!! the stuff we have seen on this is WOW

m.com/apps/webstore/products/show/1688631

ot with it....

8

=C2=
=A0 

Agreed, it is the best camera to get. =C2=A0There are several models =
available: some have built in IR lights, some have IR / UV lights, some are=
 set-up for sky watching, and others are just plain ol' full spectrum. 


W=
ith this camera (depending on the model, a regular one with the different o=
ptions run around $120-150), you will also need the power supply ($12-$20),=
 a tripod, and a portable recorder. =C2=A0My group uses 2 of them and each =
one is attached to a portable DVD recorder that has a small LCD screen, you=
 can find these refurbished for under $100.


Tim


On Sun, Dec 12, 2010 at=
 3:51 PM, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@...> wrote:

oh on=
e more thing just because something say full spectrem does not mean it actu=
ally full spectrum the camera i have is the one that ghost adventures,ghost=
 hunter,Bill murpghy etc have...this is the one to get!
